value.name: Biological Sciences | Internship and Career Center - UC Davis
value.snippet: There is a broad range of careers related to biological sciences, including careers in research and development, biomedical sciences, organismal biology, biotechnology and pharmaceutical manufacturing, bioinformatics, education, science and technical writing, and healthcare. You can build the basic skills needed to pursue a biological sciences career through your lecture and laboratory coursework and hands-on internship, volunteer, and work experiences. It is best to find a career that will ...

value.name: General Catalog - Internship Program - UC Davis
value.snippet: Internship courses (092, 192, & 292) are available for credit on a variable-unit and Passed/Not Passed (P/NP) grading basis. For most students, a maximum of 12 units of P/NP courses may be counted toward the 180-unit minimum needed for graduation. To qualify for the 192 course, students must have acquired 84 units of credit.

value.name: Global Learning Hub - UC Davis Summer Abroad Internships
value.snippet: Work remotely while earning UC Davis credit and connecting with professionals around the globe with our new UC Davis virtual summer internships. Visit Virtual Summer Internships to learn more. Placements are available in many of the same fields listed above. Summer Abroad Internships 2024 Animal and Veterinary Science Business and Communication ...

value.name: Summer Internships - Enrollment | Global Learning Hub
value.snippet: Create a UC Davis Study Abroad Account. Fill out your profile with your programs of interest. Start your enrollment; available in early December for Summer Abroad Internships programs. Starting on January 10, 2024 at 9 a.m., complete all steps of the Enrollment section, pay your $300 non-refundable deposit, and submit your enrollment.

value.name: UC Davis | Biochemistry and Molecular Biology Major
value.snippet: Major Requirements. You will begin your studies with foundation courses in biology, chemistry, physics and mathematics. At the upper-division level, you will take a four-course sequence in advanced biological topics and an intensive laboratory course designed to introduce you to the methods and procedures used in studying biochemical processes ...

value.name: Get Experience - Undergraduate Research - Internship and Career Center
value.snippet: Internships can be advertised or you can develop your own internship opportunity. UC Davis students participate in basic and applied research with faculty on campus, at the UC Davis Health System and in local businesses and non-profits. Typical research internships are 10-12 hours a week, with a multiple quarter commitment. ... Research internships usually qualify for transcript notation. During the summer, many full-time research internships are available. Be clear about the expectations ...

value.name: Internship and Career Center - Find Internships
value.snippet: Internships Defined. Internships at UC Davis are supervised work-learn experiences in a professional environment outside the classroom to help a student's academic and career goals. An internship requires a minimum 10-week quarter commitment and can span multiple quarters. Internships are guided, supervised and evaluated by professionals.

value.name: Summer Internship for Undergraduate Students - CBST Website - UC Davis
value.snippet: The CBST hosts a Summer Internship Program. for Undergraduate students. For a period of 8 to 12 weeks students get involved in on-going research projects in the following areas: Bioimaging, Molecular & Cellular Biophotonics and Medical Biophotonics.
